NURBS module¶

Basic NURBS Manipulation

This module implement certain base functions of isogeometric analysis, including the B-Splines given the knot vector and base points, or the NURBS given the weight vector in addition.

See also

A comprehensive reference can be found in the book of Thomas J.R. Hughes.

NURBS.BSpline(knot, i, p, x)¶

Function generating B-Spline function by recurrence.

Parameters:
  • knot (array) – knot vector.
  • i (int) – order of B-Spline
  • p (int) – polynomial degree.
  • x (float) – position in parametric domain.
Returns:

value of the i-th B-Spline function of degree p at point x.
Return type:

(float)
NURBS.BSplineArray(knot, p, x)¶

Function generating B-Spline functions by array recurrence. This function calculates all B-Spline of degree p, thus has better running time.

Note

To facilitate the implementation, we add [-1] to the beginning of knot vector and the return vector. For example, one should call the function with knot = [-1,0,1,2] if one want the knot vector to be [0,1,2]

Parameters:
  • knot (int array) – knot vector.
  • p (int) – polynomial degree.
  • x (float) – position in parametric domain.
Returns:

value of the all i-th B-Splines of degree p at point x.
Return type:

(float array)
NURBS.NURBSArray(knot, w, p, x)¶

Function generating NURBS functions by array recurrence. This function calculates all NURBS of degree p.

Note

To facilitate the implementation, we add [-1] to the beginning of knot vector. For example, one should call the function with knot = [-1,0,1,2] if one want the knot vector to be [0,1,2]

Parameters:
  • knot (int array) – knot vector.
  • w (float array) – weight vector.
  • p (int) – polynomial degree.
  • x (float) – position in parametric domain.
Returns:

value of the all i-th B-Splines of degree p at point x.
Return type:

(float array)
